v-AvPP0N_mtPCaRj7taSQQ.text: Although Gusto is part of a chain, it can be quite easy to forget that as the food is all so tasty and the staff are very attentive. Not your bog standard Italian, as it has a very classy feel about it. A nice place to go for a first date, or somewhere to catch up with the girls. The cocktail menu is excellent.

nKoIjrz8en1ZLrR0GgAKfQ.text: visited with 6 friends ro so and service was great. Rib Eye steak was perfect.

1UlS_hw6vOA3HeJx7p9XMA.text: Great food! Great service! Great wait staff! Great reception staff! Great barman! Thank you for a wonderful evening. I treated some friends out for a good evening meal and Gusto has not failed. Thanks everyone!

a6J7xAo8elvSXKS5ByZCdg.text: Went here on a Saturday night at 7pm the place was bizzy with a good buzz about the place, there wasn't any problems atall with the service, we were well looked after by our waitress, the food was great I opted for the fillet steak which was cooked to perfection. we both had 3 courses and 2 btl wine and a btl water and it was 102 which we thought was quite reasonable for the quality and service we received.

c2Vz2QCFhU9sxogbDsCoEg.text: Gusto in George St serves up classic Italian food in a modern and stylish setting, it is certainly a cut above most of the city centre's other Italian restaurants. Given the sheer size of this place you are pretty much either guaranteed a table or a very short wait for one, and if you do have to wait, it is worth it. The tables outside are ideally placed for a spot of people watching and, in this area, there are generally a few amusing characters passing by to entertain you. The food covers all bases in regards to the pizza and pasta offerings that you'd expect, but throws in a few surprises too: suckling pig anyone? The calamari is very good and never chewy or rubbery, and the figs, ham and mozzarella is a wonderfully simple and tasty dish. This is a great place to come with someone fussy, they'll find something nice and safe to enjoy  (yip, they do Bolognese AND Carbonara) while you explore the more adventurous parts of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

nkL8rjmgER1r-pr0vU7dJA.text: Lovely atmosphere at a great location. Beautiful restaurant inside with nice seating and tables. The food is brilliant and tasty would highly recommend it. Staff are very freindly

MFSZRil1qb4DCJLirareXw.text: Although all the reviews here seem to go back and forth, we had a pretty good experience. We found the food really tasty, especially dessert. Our waiter was extremely helpful and nice. We were given a good table quickly without a reservation and this on a pretty busy night. Maybe we were lucky in comparison to the other reviews we read on here but I had a very pleasant experience. Would definitely come back the next time in Edinburgh. One star deduction though for the sub-par toilets and area around toilets. Restaurant is well executed and then you go through the back door to the toilet area and it's all downhill from there.

99n1pFZc3F3ef_DsRBED9w.text: I had an excellent experience here on my birthday and was very impressed by the service we received and viewed other customers receiving. As I'm shortly to have a baby, I was impressed by the accommodation of a family with their twins, where the waiter whipped out 2 high chairs and helped them fold away their buggy as well as letting the children eat their own food. Perhaps it was my ample belly that did it but my pizza was parma ham and mozzarella pizza was very generously stacked with rocket and parmesan.

QyqWAGXCN3Bedw8Z6mBYWw.text: Gustos is located on George Street in Edinburgh. The restaurant used to be Est Est Est but was changed to Gusto a number of months ago. The decor there is very nice and the service levels of the staff is always pretty good. The food is good and not overly expensive. Maybe don't go on a busy weekend night if you are looking for a quiet romantic meal because it can get very busy and noisy. However it is perfect for a quiet night during the week or as a large crowd during the weekend. The menu overall is great (considering this is part of a chain). Definitely worth a visit.

GsfPMqhHjSFtyHkjpwfl9w.text: My husband took me and our children here for dinner on a Saturday evening and it was absolutely fantastic. The waiter who served us was very knowledgeable on the food and wine but was also very good with our children (who got to make their own pizzas)! The food was stunning as was the whole atmosphere of the evening. Couldn't recommend this place enough - it caters for all occasions! Can't wait to go back.

jMpEEpeCZ7KsthFZ_u5j6w.text: I've been here a few times and always had a very enjoyable experience. The food is really good, much better than the usual italian chains. I would recommend the pizzas, they are very authentic and also the nutella and mascarpone calzona for pudding- amazing!

I4n3eDh2qRgD6LFOG-g1SA.text: Est Est Est is located on George Street which is a really good spot as it's full of bars and restaurants. It can be very busy and loud so isn't always good for a quiet meal but for large parties and families it is perfect. The Italian menu is excellent, I would recommend the garlic and rosemary potatoes as a side dish!

RISpGQO1R924rrzgnIPUAQ.text: This is part of a chain so you always know what to expect, fortunately it is always a great experience unlike some chains. The menu is extensive and is really tasty. Modern surroundings and really friendly staff. It is also very reasonable in comparison to some of the other Italian restauraunts in the area. I'd definitely recommend, the steaks are fab...

hdpj_gfJdCknP1wQTcrr_Q.text: I've only been here once, but the food was delicious and the service was great, despite my severe lack of ordering skills. The place has a good atmosphere and the prices are far more reasonable than those of its predecessor 'Est Est Est'. In my opinon, definitely worth a visit, although more of a once in a while eating place. than an every week for lunch place.

74OEedt_N-4pkY4gpQYjsg.text: I went here for a special meal last night and I think we all had a lovely meal.  The layout is a bit strange, for my more traditional tastes. I found the booths comfortable but being seated near the kitchen and the stairs I felt a bit shunted towards the back.  The staff were lovely, our waitress was so smiley and laughed along with some of the more cringy jokes made by a member of our party. (My Dad. Bless him.)  The food was good, We were casually asked if we would like some bread and olives for the table. I had the chicken pate to start, more bread would be appreciated but the toasted bread they serve with it is gorgeous. For my main I had the scallop, pancetta and avocado salad (they had me at scallop...then pancetta...then avocado...) which was really good, although the dressing wasn't great, it didn't fit too well.  For dessert I shared the 'Bombilinis' and thank goodness too. The amount of sugar had my teeth trying to escape as soon as I set eyes on them. And it ended up everywhere.  Overall it was enjoyable, the service was great and the food was great but nothing to write home about.  And don't go for the bread and olives...it's 6.

r_pZ1Fi8h0Q6WMPPLmZBOA.text: Gusto definitely changed my opinion on Italian restaurants.   Until I ate here I was of the opinion that to be good, an italian eatery had to be 'cheap & cheerful' and a bit rough round the edges, and absolutely not part of a national chain. Gusto meets neither of these criteria, and yet it's definitely one of the best restaurants in the George Street area.  I went mid-week for dinner, and was surprised at how busy it was. Deceptively large once inside, the opulent decor and subtle lighting makes it perfect for an intimate dinner for two, yet the buzzing ambience and fashionable air of the place would also make it an ideal place to start a night out.  The food was lovely, if slightly pricey. However, i loved the fact that they have a Healthy Living Menu - i could still eat out but didn't have to go to the gym the next day, and both courses were bursting with flavour, which is usually a rare find among Lighter Options. However, for those not watching their figure, my partner's 28-Day Aged Premium Steak with grilled tomato and fries (12.95) looked so good i couldn't help but steal a bit off his plate when he went to the loo.  The service was spot-on, attentive and thorough without being intrusive, and I didn't have to think twice about whether or not I was going to leave a tip.  Don't miss... if you're a student, remember to take your snapfax, as you get 20% off food prices from the A La Carte menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. image courtesy of www.gustorestaurants.uk.com

Y77iUfeqWWeK5PtaQmOZQA.text: I've been to Gusto a number of times now, due to its convenient west end George Street location and because it's set out over pretty large premises, so there's always a good chance of getting a speedy table in times of post shopping starvation need.  The menu is extensive, which is brilliant, because I never feel I'm stuck going for the same tired options, which can be the case if you regularly frequent somewhere with a small menu that doesn't seem to change an awful lot. Great options for both lunch and dinner, and being an Italian restaurant, there are tasty pasta, rice, pizza, salad, meat and seafood options to choose from. I usually opt for the seafood risotto teamed with rocket and parmesan salad, a combination I find never goes wrong.   The interior looks good, very modern and light, with big booths to slide into and a choice of romantic tables for two for some hand holding and such like. There is also an upstairs level, and a long communal table through the middle of the restaurant, where people can sit either side, which I think is pretty cool. Fantastic Bellinis too, they've definitely lured me in here more than once. Add outside seating to that -  great for posing in oversized sunnies on a good day.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Photo from gustorestaurants.uk.com

k2Na8vC6d1kxAZGiCm1e8A.text: Gusto originates from the Latin word Gustus meaning 'a tasting' and THAT it certainly is!   Gusto is one of my favourite restaurants in Edinburgh. I have been here too many times to count and have dragged pretty much all my pals to it.  It all started 2 years ago......   I visited this place for the first time when I was meeting someone for lunch. Having been out the night before, I had struggled to even walk the length of George street and had hoped that lunch would comprise of a ham and cheese toastie at some obscure cafe with no alcohol in sight to upset my already churning belly.  My pleas were obviously ignored by my pal who had no sympathy for the state I was in and is a firm believer in a good feed being the solution for all of life's problem when accompanied by good wine.   So we arrived and were seated at a corner booth. The service was prompt and efficient and the Italian waiter who served us somehow convinced me to order a bottle of wine. It may have been the fairy lights or the delectable aromas wafting through the place, or just the overly flirty 50 year old Italian waiter but I fell for his charm and ordered a lovely bottle of Red to go with my lunch.  I had duck for my main which was deliciously succulent with rosemary potatoes and my pal had a pork loin, pork belly combo. My pal thought that the pork belly was a tad tough but didn't complain because the rest had been so tasty. The manager picked up on the fact that the plate hadn't been emptied and asked her why. We had 25% knocked off the food when the bill arrived and it came accompanied by a sincere apology from the manager.  While I would have definitely revisited the place after tasting the food, that experience made me even more determined to go back.    I have tried plenty things on the menu since and still can't decide what I like best.   Their griffin pizza is amazingly spicy and filling, while their lobster and prawn spaghetti makes a simple pasta dish into something special. Their steaks are cooked to perfection and try the lasagne for a more home-made touch.   The Sticky toffee pud is one of my favourites indulgences with the chocolate brownie with pistachio ice-cream just perfect to satisfy chocolate cravings for chocolate or the Lemon Sorbet for when you 'just can't have another bite'  They have a good selection of cocktails and the prices are pretty reasonable for what they are. The Raspberry Caiproska and Strawberry Daiquiri are lovely and refreshing and they have a nice bar for those who wish to stop for just a drink or two and to enjoy the romantic fairy lights....   To sum it up.... I think the service, the food and the ambience are all pretty fantastic and so are the prices especially for a George street haunt.

KpOZjl6NVBL0K17pSM2Xyg.text: Very nice looking Italian restaurant on George street. Had a lovely lonely dinner there by myself. The staff was great and the food even better. Great marinated olives and I highly recommend the gnocchi with pulled pork, pesto and tomatoes, absolutely delicious and the serving size was perfect. The restaurant was not very full when I got there around 5pm, but filled up very quickly so I would book a table in advance. I Will definitely be back for another meal.

GmC7_FxwFUvrclBHT3rZ-Q.text: I've eaten here three or four times as its very convenient to where I live. The food (in particular the pizzas) is good. The service is excellent also. I think we have been a few times where deals have been on offer (birthdays etc) so keep your eye out for a special deal!

VSM-mxoGnn2o47estaXL9Q.text: First response to going out with the Beloved's boss: ooh, great, they're lovely. Second response after contracting viral plague: I'm going to have to get some hardcore medicinal support.  First response when arriving at Gusto:  Oooh, it's the pretty one with all the lights!! Second response to entering premises:  Oh, it's quite nice in here.  Then, after waiting at bar for seemingly ages, is it possible to get any service here?  First response to Honey Dew Mocktail:  Oh my god that's lovely! Pint of Hoegaarden and Honey Dew, between 7 - 8.  Our booth is pleasant and we have a good view of the rest of the restaurant; the mezzanine looks nice and they've used the space well to fit in ample seating without seeming to overcrowd it.  The service was adequate but not what I'd call brilliant, with several people waiting on the table over the course of the meal and no one standing out as giving fantastic service.  The meals themselves were quite good - the tomato-smothered chiken skewers and scallops were particularly good, however, the tiger prawns were a bit more like tiger cubs drowning in too much creamy sauce which itself was over-spiced.  The mushrooms and carpaccio was better than the prawns but not as good as the chicken and scallops.  The mains were similarly differentiated.  The mushroom risotto was very salty but cooked to just the right consistency; the seafood risotto passed the test, the lasagne was very good and the pizza was huge and looked fresh and tasty.  Having ordered dessert and coffee, a beer was brought to our table that we hadn't ordered.  We had read several reviews that talked about this and suggesting that the bill should be checked rigorously.  Dessert was a rather wonderful affair; the sticky toffee pudding was a favourite of someone at our table and the apple tart with marscapone and almonds was lovely.  The marscapone was actually a very creamy ice cream on top of the tart.  The apple and almond filling was delicious and light, not over-sweetened, and hit the spot for my sore throat but the overly-creamy ice cream left me feeling a little like the dsh was just not quite right - but I do reserve the right to go back and try it when I'm not sick!!  Coffee was not to the high standard that would have capped off an otherwise good (if not exceptional) meal, which was disappointing given the large barrista area they have for making lavazza, a firm favourite of the beloved.    All in all, it was a really pleasant evening.  The venue itself has the ambience and atmosphere/decor to suggest a relatively chic offering.  Unfortunately, the service and food standards let it down just enough to tip me to three stars rather than four.  Also, boys beware:  there was some kind of grease on the stairs to the mensroom and two of our party nearly slipped when trying to make their way to or from.  But it did have a number of plusses - certainly enough to make me go back and try it again.  As Cheryl C. says, the menu is extensive and some of the duck dishes and salads sounded amazing.  But I have to also agree with Tom D that it feels a bit like the venue is let down by some of the other elements.

rinRBWj6i8sT1g0YGRHFGQ.text: Salt. One of the most essential ingredients to bring out flavours and make your dinner all the more tastier. Gusto seemed to have missed out on this point and although the ambiance is great and I would recommend this place highly for a date, both our lamb cutlets and duck breast lacked the S word. They were both actually cooked to perfection- the duck especially was just the right about of pink in it. However the fat was soggy and cooking it slower would have made it amazing.  I am picky about food  and cooking as you may have realised. Other than the slightly bland food,  great place and friendly service!

6WdDdQEcSfEJGduyyheRMw.text: We are about to finish our dinner , but so dar great experience! Decor is nice, staff top class and very good food. One plate was not great but the manager handles it professionally and make all the difference.

pqBAmspLZX09nsLEArTizw.text: Good, but not totally great, sums up my sole experience of Gusto.  My pasta was in all honesty, similar to something I could make at home, but E's. loaded with salmon and oddly, peas was tremendous. This game of contrasts also spread to the garlic pizza bread, with the tomato basted half coming a cropper in favour of the simpler, garlic drenched section.  The waiter got on my wick a bit as well, relentlessly upselling and a bit sleazy but not in a comical way.   I'd go back though for the salmon pasta, and we did get to see a somewhat comical scene next to us, with the stingiest teen in the world taking his girlfriend for a date. Not only did he make her drink tap water, he loudly announced she could have "whatever she wanted" from the menu, before strongly suggesting she have the garlic pizza bread (made and priced as a starter / side dish) for her main course.  Someone's now in the friend zone.

0ZO9jw2Xgb245NNrZcHFQQ.text: My expectations were elevated upon entering Gusto. It was busy and I liked the ambiance, plus the menu looked very appetizing.    Food was decent, but not very memorable -- and service was lacking some attention. Still, I did really like the vibe and think they have a lot to work with....could be a great neighborhood place.

guEzDqF-Xi6K4oEfIyNNmw.text: hmm this is a rather difficult review to write as i went here for a work xmas lunch and feel like we didn't get to sample their actual menu!  this is of course a gripe of the festive season as instead of offering the normal menu all places think that everyone just wants to eat turkey and christmas pudding....  but anyway, i have to say that while gusto does put on a special menu for their xmas lunch and dinner it's very good!  we arrived at 2pm and were seated right away at a long table.  my only problem with this is that you were rather limited in who you could talk to as it was the people immediately across from you or next to you.  one of their round booths would have been nice so i could have seen everyone, but it might have been our party was too big.  also i find sitting under the mezzanine level makes things a bit dark, but perhaps some people see this as atmospheric.  from their xmas menu i ordered the butternut squash soup, the turkey with all the trimmings, and the chocolate tart.  although we were a large party and they appeared to have quite a few of these our food was brought out very promptly after our order!  i really appreciated this as two cocktails into the drinks already and a full glass of wine in front of me, i was desperate for some food!!  the soup was absolutely delicious!  it was the perfect winter warmer for a cold day with a nice smooth consistency and a warm squashy taste to it.  it was topped with toasted pumpkin seeds and had a side of nice freshly baked bread that i used to wipe the bowl clean.  the turkey was next and i have to say it was really only ok.  i found the meat to be a wee bit dry and my food cooled off far too quickly after it arrived and the brussel sprouts with pancetta were almost cold by the time i finished them.  however, they were still rather tasty and the portion of stuffing was just delicious!!  i also really enjoyed the extra sides of roast potatoes and sauteed veggies.  my chocolate tart was lovely but i was far too full to finish it so it sadly got mostly left over!  the service we had was impeccable!  i really could not fault our waiter, he was so lovely and helpful and always checking to make sure we had everything we needed.  he also kindly suggested frangelico instead of amaretto for an after dinner liquor which me and some of my colleauges enjoyed so much we ended up having three!  so excellent suggestion from an excellent waiter!  he also let us sit at the table almost two hours longer than we were told we originally had, which was a great help as our head of department was delayed and only joined us when we had almost finished the meal.  however, this did not phase the waiter and he brought out her meal when she arrived and never rushed her between the courses.  i definitely enjoyed my team lunch here and from that experience i'll happily be back to sample more of their normal menu.  i have been here once or twice before and know they do italian food well, so although i enjoyed the meal i do wish that we'd just been able to order off their normal menu because who says you can't have pizza for xmas?!?!

2bcuomodrupWcP50kdgslg.text: I decided to go into Gusto for a light lunch as I had heard two women on the train chatting about how fantastic it was.   Gusto is one of the bigger eateries in Edinburgh which is great because it means no waiting and plenty of staff. I was eating alone which I hate beyond hate, however I think the waitress knew this because she tried to seat me at an inconspicuous table which I appreciated!  I was impressed to see that they had a one course lunch menu including a drink, alcoholic or soft, and I decided to go for that. I had a glass of red wine which was very nice for what was probably a cheap bottle of house, and opted for the spaghetti with chicken and pesto. There wasn't a great deal of choice to be honest and I was disappointed there wasn't more of a pasta choice.  My meal came in super quick time, and I can't fault it. The spaghetti was very al dente, and the pesto was delicious. There wasn't an awful lot of chicken in the dish but what was there was cooked perfectly.  I left very satisfied with my lonesome lunch, and only 8.95 lighter! Great deal for great food. The dinner menu looks pretty good so maybe a dinner time visit is in order soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qLHW4bysvUJq5rlo-eILIg.text: I've been to a lot of italian restaus in edinburgh and Gusto is the greatest, well first of all they had non alcoholic cocktails so that was heaven for me! n it was great.   we had a pizza bread for a starter , half of it was mozzarella n half tomato with basil and it tasted really good n the texture was perfect.   for main i had chicken in a creamy sauce with mushroom and polenta (a substitute for potato i was told ) anyway it was all delicious and the sauce ... YUM!   portions were quite large so i couldn't have a dessert!   the price was good .   parking on a sunday is quite hard but i got lucky.

Antp06_h9OHqw12v8-eITw.text: I dont know what to write as my review of this place.  In some aspects it was great - it really excelled itself in terms of food (a great modern take on classic italian food), the decore was nice and the staff were friendly.  But, it was missing something. It was an odd atmosphere - not exactly cold, but certainly not welcoming and friendly. It left me feeling slightly on edge, and I was relieved when we finally left after paying a bill that I thought was very expensive for what we had eaten.  As I said, its hard to call this one, so try it and see.

HlHRIiHog3ol-KwFdLdF_w.text: I came here on a second date with a guy once and swiftly ordered the French Martini (as I had been watching Sex and The City all day). It arrived with a huge blueberry in the centre, which I thought was a nice touch. So nice, infact, that I then threw the martini all over the girl next to me and smashed my glass. Real smooth.  Clumsiness aside, I really liked Gusto's. They have a nice layout, with a huge table in the middle to accomodate bigger parties and small booths and intimate tables all around it. My mum and I ordered the garlic bread on the side - big mistake! It was huge! Too big for us to share! I had duck, which was cooked to perfection. My mum had spaghetti Carbonara which she said was really light and not too much. They aways have a decent discount on offer, so ask the waiter/waitress for the latest deals.

7P5jbCYLV4FiGCR0TRwFAQ.text: Visited for lunch a few times and always had a good time.  The restaurant is very modern and you can view some of the chiefs preparing the food from the kitchen.  I have sat both upstairs and in the booths, the first time I visited was on a busy saturday afternoon and it was rather loud, other times I have gone during lunchtime on a weekday and it has been fairly quiet.   I recommend the farmhouse loaf for a starter and also the Italian burger, one of the best burgers I have ever had.   Great place for food in the city

Ed3OK1KG8nA87aGjJ0k_PA.text: Ideal place for a largish get together. Good selection of food should keep everyone happy. Similar in a lot of ways to Browns next door. It was out first visit party of 9 and I thnk everyone enjoyed the food and atmosphere.

xzBm-RVsZ-5VX6MfswYV0w.text: I've been to Gusto twice recently. Our first visit was because Brown's next door couldn't take us for over an hour, so we look at Gusto's menu and stepped in. Overall, the experience was a good one. The food was tasty, though as noted by a previous reviewer, it did arrive extremely quickly. In addition, a couple of the sider order were missing. The waiting staff were a little hard to get hold of once the food had been delivered to our table and my veg side eventually turned up 20 minutes into the meal. They were very apologetic however.   The second visit was planned, but was a bit of a disaster. After a long day's shopping in Edinburgh, we decided that Gusto was a preferable option to Browns as it was extremely quiet. In fact, it was nearly empty. We asked for a booth located at the far end of the restaurant, away from the front door and the freezing wind whistling through it. The waitress said she'd have to check with the manager. We were told 'no'. We then asked for a table in the upstairs section, to be told it would be possible if we 'finished up in half an hour'.   We pointed out that the restaurant was empty and asked her to check again. The manager was about 10 feet away from us, doing some paperwork. He never once turned to face us, never mind speak to us. We were once again told 'no'.   I decided at this point to eat elsewhere and told her so - she shrugged and we left. Browns, though crowded, got us a great table in 15minutes - we enjoyed a drink at the bar in the interim, and wondered just why Gusto was so empty   Maybe they were booked to the rafters. They never said so. Maybe they were having an 'off' day. Pretty poor customer service in any event, though I may give them another go if I'm in the neighbourhood.

WKZEwWX1zX2PWXoDd7hw9Q.text: Everything about Gusto is amazing, the staff are friendly and attentive, the decor is fab, the seating is very comfortable and the food is to die for.   The decor is very fancy with a black and white theme going on and they have comfortable leather booths that can accommodate up to seven diners.   The dinner menu was extensive which made it a difficult decision when deciding what I wanted, I was very surprised as the prices were a lot less than I had anticipated with the average price of a main around 9. I opted for the penne salmon pasta after hearing that it was the best thing ever. You know what? It was. Absolutely delicious with a gorgeous creamy sauce, garden peas, spinach and a very generous amount of salmon mixed in. At first glance, it didn't look like a big portion and I was a little worried it wasn't going to fill me up as I was starving. I couldn't have been more wrong, the portion was rather deceiving and was actually so filling that I struggled to finish it but waste not want not, and you really can't justify wasting something that tasty, it was amazing. We also got a garlic bread pizza side which was amazing and one of my friends got "The Griffin" pizza and after sampling a slice, I can confirm that it's definitely up there with the best pizzas ever.  For dessert I went for the "berry mess" which was massive, and a very reasonable 5.75. The meringue was delicious, and the berries were really sweet and refreshing.  Overall, a fantastic restaurant, phenomenal food, great surroundings and staff that cannot do enough to help. Thumbs up!

RYn_bCUzYn2JRyqZuaTMoQ.text: Nice place, great service. Good atmosphere. Nice and relaxed an ideal place to kick off a night on the town.   Food is excellent, nice and tasty and good value.

2fzUyArsbiKanoORnplUZg.text: Loved this place!  I'll admit it got my attention with the sparkly string lights in their front windows, but it was a lovely experience!  Our server was very nice, lots of GF options (which is great for my complicated self), I had the risotto and it was delicious!  We also had dessert cocktails which really finished the meal off nicely.  It was a bit hard at the end of our meal to find out server to pay, but that's no big deal.  We also were sat at the front of the restaurant, I wanted to be by the fairy lights, but the place was huge! Fortunately our front side was sparsely seated, so it was pretty quiet, but towards the back people definitely sounded like they were enjoying themselves.  Nice dinner find after wandering the streets aimlessly for 30+ minutes.

fM20dMZv28-GdrchAIimeg.text: A little disappointed.  Ordered the "garlic bread".  It was more like a pizza.   Was ok, but not great.   Olives were good, but you really can't do them wrong. :)     Next I ordered the pork Belly and my brother the lasagna. Pork Belly was just not that tender.   It should have been fall apart tender!  The description in the menu was much better than the product delivered.  My brother said the Lasagna was not great either.  The kicker is the waiter.   He was horrible.   Hard time remembering anything we asked for, and when I asked him to describe the preparation of the two items I was considering (basically, sell me!). He gave me a very rudimentary explanation of each item.   Like..."the pork Belly is a square piece". Really?  And..."the duck is a duck leg". Very odd     I have had so Much better elsewhere and yet the reviews were fairly good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork Belly
Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lasagna
Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9Jan2JbOsCQRgVnZUGL3Gg.text: The food here is amazing. Fresh pasta, fresh fish. Great apps. Reasonable wine list. Very good service. I would easily come back again on my next visit to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

OY845p1EwcqCdJSy314XwQ.text: Very nice restaurant on George Street. We were a group of five in for a meal on a Sunday evening, and we had a nice booth with plenty of space. Staff members were attentive and friendly, and I enjoyed being able to see the kitchen from the table, such is the way the restaurant is laid out. I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza, and saw the dough being freshly made into a delicious pizza. Yummy!  Other members of the group had a vegetarian pizza, the Gusto burger, and some pasta dishes. All were tasty and filling. We also ordered two of the pizza bread appetisers, but those are much larger than expected, so keep that in mind! We couldn't finish both sadly.  The food was washed down with some nice beers and wine, and we all really enjoyed the meal overall. I wasn't even hungry the next morning, so filling was the meal! Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

oLca360bd1qVldupd2c9gA.text: Ambience was good and had us upbeat as we sat down, but ultimately the food and overall experience was poor.  Slow service to begin. Pizza especially disappointing - lacked flavor and not even fully cooked.  Side salad carelessly presented.  Cheese platter charcuterie plate with just 2 pieces of bread. Very subpar. Will not return.

ZTfh9Z0yk3qsXnxLNzH7yQ.text: We were here to celebrate a birthday. Yes they are part of a chain but I don't think you should let that put you off from coming here. The decor is authentic and well thought out. The service was excellent (especially given that there were 8 of us including 2 children). The menu is extensive and seasonal which is great. The specials board had loads of options on it too if you didn't fancy anything off the main menu.  A great place for a work lunch, a date or even a group meal.  The food is tasty, the flavours sometimes surprising and the quality excellent even though the place was heaving!  I see some people have had a bad experience here but I can't really knock it. I've also been to their restaurant in Leeds which was equally as excellent (their decor and ambience actually tops Edinburgh's). I thought it was great, I'd go back here and I would also recommend others to go here too.

pqoDTXA_tSgUY-iQf-AM2w.text: What a fantastic place to spend time with friends and colleagues after a hard days of work,especially now during Christmas time when all the decorative lights and decorations are up. On entry you will come across a massive Christmas tree, one you only see in big posh houses. And it also looked real to me. Such a delight!  The bar area is in the front and we took hold of an area in a corner near the big windows. The barman was quick at hand, took our orders and handed us a tab key, which we could use at any time to order more.  Our table was booked at 7.30 and was ready for us at any time. Eric was our efficient waitor for the whole evening. Whilst our table was just opposite an open kitchen and occasionally there was some loud noice, it was still a cozy wee corner, ideal for entertainment.   Eric recommended an italian starter mix, so we went with his choice, which comprised of olives, artisan bread and garlic pizza bread. For a main I ordered the rib eye steak with peppercorn sauce and fries. The thinly cut french fries were just right and complemented the steak favourably. Both, the steak and the peppercorn sauce were spicy. But the taste, just magnificent! The steak was thinly cut and literally tender, nearly melting in your mouth.  Now, to the best part. As a dessert I ordered Affogato: vanilla ice cream poured over with a shot of espresso and amaretto. Soooo delicious.  It's really a great place to enjoy dinner and suitable for everybody.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Awesome affogato with amaretto

b7UtvS8cbD0IrucjxxcVDQ.text: A solid choice among the George Street cluster - swish enough to feel much nicer than your average Italian chain (though I think there are a few of these around the country), but not so high end enough as to break the bank. The menu is extensive, spanning pizzas, pastas and a lengthy list of meat dishes. I took one look at my mate and I knew he'd had the same idea as me - steak o'clock! I really enjoyed my 6oz fillet steak, and I liked the addition of a juicy roasted vine tomato as well as chips and not-too-buttery peppercorn sauce. My mate amped it up to a 10oz fillet which was a better size for him though his medium-rare looked as pink as my medium, i.e. not very. Still it seemed of good quality and satisfied the steak cravings nicely, helped down by mr malbec.  Despite being a pretty big place with an extra mezzanine half floor it's always packed in here, especially on weekend evenings, so best to book ahead. We had a late sitting at 9.30pm this time so service was lovely but a little slow towards the end of the meal as they were basically packing things up. There's a small bar area at the front which is nice to wait for your table and peruse the drinks menu - as you inevitably ending up having to do. Quite a mix of clientele here too, from very dolled up hen parties to casually-dressed family dinners (averting their eyes from the hen parties) to couples on date night.  What I really like about this place though is the decor. The double-height wall on the right hand side is entirely covered in framed black and white photos that is a really simple yet effective decor trick. I'm also a complete sucker for fairy lights, so dressing the entire front window with a cascade of golden lights just draws me in like a moth to a flame.  Particularly good when you've got fussy eaters with you given the largely inoffensive menu, and I'm sure I'll be back again!

f2wmssaXRr7WaDNv-gxSmw.text: The food was so bad. Ordered the carbonara pasta which was so salty from the half pound of bacon in it, the pork belly entree which was so bland and overlooked that the meat was tough, the broccoli which was under cooked and had no flavor. The meat board starter was pretty decent. Lovely decor, might be night to just get a drink here.

1flqZO0yH74sJg-RydMV6Q.text: Really would like a 3-1/2 stars.  The people were really nice but the food was just good - not bad but not memorable.  Overall the service was good but they missed a salad and rushed the sequence somewhat.

xpqG8rmbU_Me9opUq9Rzag.text: Food tasted great and service is reliable and good. The entree orders are sizably smaller than pasta orders and starters are small...like only shareable between 2 people. Would come later in the night rather than earlier. BUT in an incredible location and has an amazing atmosphere. Amazing though portion size was off.

PXbgVB2HLjhqGdGJmA-rfA.text: Another great meal at Gusto.  This time I went with a school friend of mine.  With a 50% off food January sale there is every reason to be a social butterfly and catch up with everyone!    My friend tried a new pudding this time, the hot chocolate brownie with ice cream rather than the chocolate sauce, I tasted it and it was delicious and I may have to try that the next time that I am in.   I always request a booth when I make reservations as I think that they are nicer than the tables, personal preference I suppose but I think that it gives you a wee area for your group, more room. I had to prompt this this time as they automatically went to seat us at a table, but they quickly found us a booth.  I think I may be able to squeeze one more visit here before the sale finishes, although going for a catch up with school friends means that the wine bill is higher than the food bill!

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate brownie &amp; ice cream
Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Caprino pizza

CSWMJgHlF4hVl-0cXgqFDQ.text: I often go to Gusto for lunch, the staff are friendly, the food is good quality Italian fare and the prices are reasonable. In fact it actually seems like it should be more expensive as the interior is quite swanky!   Top Tip 1 -  If you take kids in, they'll give them little chef hats and let them make their own pizzas at the table and go meet the Chef too!   Top Tip 2 - they have a dining card which gives you up to 40% discount which is free and you can register for it on their website.  The carbonara is great, as is the sticky toffee pudding with ice cream (swoon).   They are always innovating with new events, menus, wines and cocktails and strongly support Edinburgh Sick Kids too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gusto - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. spaghetti carbonara at Gusto

mBJ8z6WF_1uP4Y8vP6px3A.text: Booked here with a large hen do at Christmas and at no point in the booking process we were told we would receive a set menu. We arrived on time, but our table was not ready.  We got to our table and were given a set Christmas menu which we didn't want and were not forewarned about. The food we received was good but overpriced.  Would not return, we werent looking for a christmas meal and if we'd known we'd get lumbered with that menu we wouldn't have picked it.

vhSO4TiNEw7FbH8P6epZ1Q.text: My man decided to treat me to some food, so we decided to try something new and went to Gustos. In all honesty this is probably the first restaurant I have been to that I would rate 10 out of 10. When you walk in you notice the lovely, sophisticated decor, as you follow a friendly member of staff that finds you a nice table.  The food we ordered thankfully didn't take long to prepare, and I am an impatient person, especially when I'm starving! I went for Gnocchi with slow roast pork, cherry tomatoes, pesto & rocket - so, so delicious. My partner got 10ozrib eye steak with mushrooms and he enjoyed it as well. For all the cocktail lovers out there, do go for the first one on the cocktail menu - Strawberry Cup - one of the best cocktails I have ever had. I was really happy with not only the gorgeous food, but also the service in the restaurant and I would really recommend it!

WroQ5z_srZpG1Mwk8Gzzqg.text: Seriously best food I've had in quite some time. Randomly discovered this place on George Street and I'm so glad we did! The tiramisu martini is AMAZING. And the desserts are out of this world. Also, amazing waiters! FIVE STARS! If you're in Edinburgh you must stop here. When I'm back, I will definitely be stopping here for at least 1 meal, if not every meal

7zBp2Ob9TLz5uU6lWORSIA.text: This place is good, not exciting but very good. It is a chain but they are not so big it feels manufactured. As it is right near where we work it is a very handy little local lunch spot. They 9.95 lunch menu has a nice selection on it - I can highly reccommend the Ceasar Salad and the sea bass - plus it includes a glass of wine. I came on a evening recently with a group and everyone enjoyed it. Good service, nice food and the big circular booths are great for a meal with friends.

3QtqU1oEuKbLdtCtVEZULg.text: Absolutely the worst food I've ever eaten in a restaurant. I think Ikea has better meatballs, and the tomato sauce tastes like it came out of a jar from the grocery store. We also called 3 days in a row for reservations, but they said they were fully booked. We walked by the restaurant 2 of those nights, and the place had many empty tables. We stopped in and they reluctantly sat us at a table. I wish they hadn't. Don't waste your time!

75lJzKViSMm70EvHbL83tg.text: Gusto delivered more than I had possibly hoped for!  As part of a group I was privileged to be able to sample multiple dishes in one sitting and not one dish was disappointing!  As soon as I walked through the door I was immediately taken with the smell of fresh herbs from the kitchen which had me walking on air to my seat.  I simply could not wait for the menu and knew this was going to be an experience.  A starter of hand rolled meatballs with grana padano cheese and tomato sauce had me wishing for a second helping.  The meatballs were indeed hand rolled as the texture had a certain unique quality that can only be achieved by hand.  A main of smoked italian sausage rigatoni had me hankering for my italian grand mothers cooking again!  I find it rare to come across an italian restaurant that would have good smoked italian sausage but this was the real thing!  Decadent, indulgent, there are no words to describe the nutella and mascarpone calzone for dessert.  I am a fan of unusual desserts but I do not exaggerate that this piece of work arrived in front of me and I scrummed myself stupid in a heady haze of chocolate fuelled delight!  If you visit Gusto you have to try this but be warned; if you don't have a big appetite then you had better have a friend to share with!  Staff were polite, accommodating, orders were taken and delivered promptly.  There was a minor mistake in one food order for which we were compensated and a new serving delivered very quickly.  I have no complaints about this particular venue and I will be back....very very soon!
